back_cards.definition_en: A casual term for a man or person.
back_cards.example_en: Hey, dude, you coming to the game tonight?

back_cards.definition_en: Used to express surprise or emphasis.
back_cards.example_en: Dude, you won’t believe what just happened!

back_cards.definition_en: A friendly way to address someone.
back_cards.example_en: I ran into this dude at the coffee shop.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for a cool or laid-back guy.
back_cards.example_en: That dude always wears the best sneakers.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to refer to someone casually.
back_cards.example_en: Some dude left his jacket at the party.

back_cards.definition_en: Higher in position or location.
back_cards.example_en: The upper shelves are hard to reach.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to a higher social or economic class.
back_cards.example_en: She lives in an upper-class neighborhood.

back_cards.definition_en: The top part of something.
back_cards.example_en: The upper part of the painting is brighter.

back_cards.definition_en: Higher in rank or importance.
back_cards.example_en: The decision came from upper management.

back_cards.definition_en: Located toward the top or north.
back_cards.example_en: The upper trail offers a better view.

back_cards.definition_en: To cover or enclose something with material.
back_cards.example_en: I’ll wrap the gift in shiny paper.

back_cards.definition_en: To finish or complete something.
back_cards.example_en: We need to wrap up the meeting soon.

back_cards.definition_en: A type of food rolled in a tortilla.
back_cards.example_en: I ordered a chicken wrap for lunch.

back_cards.definition_en: To fold or cover tightly around something.
back_cards.example_en: She wrapped the scarf around her neck.

back_cards.definition_en: To conclude filming or production.
back_cards.example_en: The movie crew wrapped shooting yesterday.

back_cards.definition_en: The chief executive officer of a company.
back_cards.example_en: The CEO announced a new company strategy.

back_cards.definition_en: The top leader in an organization.
back_cards.example_en: She’s been the CEO of the startup for years.

back_cards.definition_en: A person responsible for major decisions.
back_cards.example_en: The CEO met with investors to discuss growth.

back_cards.definition_en: The head of a business or corporation.
back_cards.example_en: Our CEO focuses on employee well-being.

back_cards.definition_en: A title for the highest-ranking executive.
back_cards.example_en: He was promoted to CEO after years of work.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to sight or things seen.
back_cards.example_en: The movie’s visual effects were stunning.

back_cards.definition_en: A picture, chart, or image used to explain.
back_cards.example_en: The presentation included a helpful visual.

back_cards.definition_en: Involving the sense of vision.
back_cards.example_en: Her visual memory helps her recall details.

back_cards.definition_en: Describing art or design elements.
back_cards.example_en: The gallery showcased bold visual art.

back_cards.definition_en: Something that can be seen or observed.
back_cards.example_en: The data was shown in a clear visual format.

back_cards.definition_en: A new plan or project to achieve a goal.
back_cards.example_en: The company launched a green initiative.

back_cards.definition_en: The ability to act without being told.
back_cards.example_en: She showed initiative by starting the task early.

back_cards.definition_en: A first step in a process or change.
back_cards.example_en: His initiative to improve safety was praised.

back_cards.definition_en: A program to address a specific issue.
back_cards.example_en: The school’s initiative promotes reading skills.

back_cards.definition_en: Taking the lead in a situation.
back_cards.example_en: Taking initiative got her noticed by the boss.

back_cards.definition_en: To move or act quickly.
back_cards.example_en: We need to rush to catch the last bus.

back_cards.definition_en: A sudden burst of activity or excitement.
back_cards.example_en: The holiday rush makes stores so crowded.

back_cards.definition_en: To hurry or do something urgently.
back_cards.example_en: Don’t rush through your homework; take your time.

back_cards.definition_en: A thrilling or intense feeling.
back_cards.example_en: Skydiving gave her a huge adrenaline rush.

back_cards.definition_en: A busy or hectic period.
back_cards.example_en: The morning rush at the café is intense.

back_cards.definition_en: A movable barrier in a fence or wall.
back_cards.example_en: Open the gate so the dog can come in.

back_cards.definition_en: An entrance or exit, like at an airport.
back_cards.example_en: Our flight leaves from gate 12.

back_cards.definition_en: A point of access or entry.
back_cards.example_en: This trail is the gate to the national park.

back_cards.definition_en: A scandal or controversy, often with ‘-gate’ suffix.
back_cards.example_en: The news covered another political gate.

back_cards.definition_en: A structure controlling flow, like water.
back_cards.example_en: The dam’s gate regulates the river’s flow.

back_cards.definition_en: At any time or every time that.
back_cards.example_en: Call me whenever you need to talk.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to indicate flexibility in timing.
back_cards.example_en: We can meet whenever works for you.

back_cards.definition_en: Every instance something happens.
back_cards.example_en: She smiles whenever she sees her dog.

back_cards.definition_en: At whatever time, no matter when.
back_cards.example_en: I’ll be ready whenever you want to leave.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to emphasize open availability.
back_cards.example_en: Stop by whenever; my door’s always open.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of entering or going in.
back_cards.example_en: Her entry into the room got everyone’s attention.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of information in a list or record.
back_cards.example_en: I added an entry to my journal last night.

back_cards.definition_en: A door or way to get inside.
back_cards.example_en: The main entry to the building is locked.

back_cards.definition_en: Participation in a contest or event.
back_cards.example_en: His painting was an entry in the art show.

back_cards.definition_en: The start of involvement in something.
back_cards.example_en: Her entry into politics surprised everyone.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to Japan or its culture.
back_cards.example_en: I love Japanese food, especially sushi.

back_cards.definition_en: A person from Japan.
back_cards.example_en: The Japanese exchange student shared her traditions.

back_cards.definition_en: The language spoken in Japan.
back_cards.example_en: He’s learning Japanese for his trip to Tokyo.

back_cards.definition_en: Describing products or art from Japan.
back_cards.example_en: This Japanese car is super reliable.

back_cards.definition_en: Connected to Japan’s history or customs.
back_cards.example_en: The festival featured Japanese dance performances.

back_cards.definition_en: A color between black and white.
back_cards.example_en: Her gray sweater matches everything.

back_cards.definition_en: Something unclear or not fully defined.
back_cards.example_en: The rules are a bit gray in this case.

back_cards.definition_en: Hair turning gray due to age.
back_cards.example_en: He’s starting to get some gray in his beard.

back_cards.definition_en: A dull or gloomy mood or appearance.
back_cards.example_en: The gray sky made the day feel dreary.

back_cards.definition_en: Neutral or lacking distinct features.
back_cards.example_en: The issue isn’t black and white; it’s gray.

back_cards.definition_en: Help or support given to someone.
back_cards.example_en: I need assistance with this heavy box.

back_cards.definition_en: Aid provided in a task or situation.
back_cards.example_en: The teacher offered assistance with the project.

back_cards.definition_en: Resources or help for those in need.
back_cards.example_en: The charity provides assistance to families.

back_cards.definition_en: Guidance or help in a process.
back_cards.example_en: She got assistance filling out the application.

back_cards.definition_en: Support in a professional or technical context.
back_cards.example_en: Tech support offered assistance with my laptop.

back_cards.definition_en: The measurement of how tall something is.
back_cards.example_en: The height of the tree is over 50 feet.

back_cards.definition_en: The peak or highest point of something.
back_cards.example_en: His career reached its height last year.

back_cards.definition_en: The distance above ground or sea level.
back_cards.example_en: The plane flew at a height of 30,000 feet.

back_cards.definition_en: The most intense or extreme point.
back_cards.example_en: The height of the storm hit at midnight.

back_cards.definition_en: A high place or elevated position.
back_cards.example_en: From this height, the view is breathtaking.

back_cards.definition_en: To strive against others to win something.
back_cards.example_en: She trained hard to compete in the race.

back_cards.definition_en: To participate in a contest or rivalry.
back_cards.example_en: Our team will compete in the championship.

back_cards.definition_en: To try to outdo others in performance.
back_cards.example_en: Companies compete to attract top talent.

back_cards.definition_en: To engage in a competitive activity.
back_cards.example_en: He loves to compete in trivia nights.

back_cards.definition_en: To vie for success or recognition.
back_cards.example_en: They compete for the best grades in class.

back_cards.definition_en: At its core or fundamentally.
back_cards.example_en: The plan is essentially the same as before.

back_cards.definition_en: In essence, focusing on the main point.
back_cards.example_en: She’s essentially saying we need more time.

back_cards.definition_en: Basically or for the most part.
back_cards.example_en: The job is essentially data entry with ascended2l work.

back_cards.definition_en: Describing the basic nature of something.
back_cards.example_en: It’s essentially a faster version of the old model.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to emphasize the primary aspect.
back_cards.example_en: The movie was essentially a comedy with drama.

back_cards.definition_en: A stage in a process or development.
back_cards.example_en: We’re in the planning phase of the project.

back_cards.definition_en: To gradually introduce or remove something.
back_cards.example_en: They’ll phase out the old machines by next year.

back_cards.definition_en: A distinct period of time or activity.
back_cards.example_en: Her teenage phase was full of rebellion.

back_cards.definition_en: A step in a cycle or sequence.
back_cards.example_en: The next phase of training starts tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: To adjust something in stages.
back_cards.example_en: The company will phase in the new policy.

back_cards.definition_en: To get better after illness or injury.
back_cards.example_en: She’s recovering from a cold this week.

back_cards.definition_en: To regain something lost or taken.
back_cards.example_en: He recovered his stolen bike from the park.

back_cards.definition_en: To return to a normal state.
back_cards.example_en: The market is recovering after the crash.

back_cards.definition_en: To heal or bounce back emotionally.
back_cards.example_en: It took time to recover from the loss.

back_cards.definition_en: To retrieve or salvage something.
back_cards.example_en: They recovered the data from the crashed drive.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of pointing out faults or flaws.
back_cards.example_en: Her criticism of the plan was constructive.

back_cards.definition_en: A negative comment or judgment.
example_en
He took the criticism about his work personally.
The analysis or evaluation of something.
back_cards.example_en: The book received mixed criticism from reviewers.

back_cards.definition_en: Disapproval expressed through critique.
back_cards.example_en: The coach’s criticism motivated the team.

back_cards.definition_en: A detailed review or assessment.
back_cards.example_en: Her criticism of the film was spot on.

back_cards.definition_en: The teaching staff of a school or college.
back_cards.example_en: The faculty met to discuss the curriculum.

back_cards.definition_en: A natural ability or skill.
back_cards.example_en: She has a faculty for solving complex problems.

back_cards.definition_en: A department or group of related subjects.
back_cards.example_en: He joined the faculty of engineering.

back_cards.definition_en: Mental or physical capabilities.
back_cards.example_en: His faculties remained sharp despite his age.

back_cards.definition_en: A body of professors or educators.
back_cards.example_en: The faculty voted on the new policy.

back_cards.definition_en: Something accomplished successfully.
back_cards.example_en: Graduating college was her greatest achievement.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of achieving a goal.
back_cards.example_en: His achievement took years of hard work.

back_cards.definition_en: A notable success or accomplishment.
back_cards.example_en: The award recognized her academic achievements.

back_cards.definition_en: A milestone or significant result.
back_cards.example_en: Winning the race was a major achievement.

back_cards.definition_en: The outcome of effort or skill.
back_cards.example_en: Her achievements in science inspired many.

back_cards.definition_en: A drink containing ethanol, like beer or wine.
back_cards.example_en: He doesn’t drink alcohol at parties.

back_cards.definition_en: A chemical substance used in drinks or cleaners.
back_cards.example_en: Rubbing alcohol cleaned the wound quickly.

back_cards.definition_en: A substance that can intoxicate.
back_cards.example_en: The bar serves alcohol after 5 PM.

back_cards.definition_en: A key ingredient in some beverages.
back_cards.example_en: This cocktail has a high alcohol content.

back_cards.definition_en: A liquid used in medical or industrial settings.
back_cards.example_en: Alcohol is used to sterilize equipment.

back_cards.definition_en: Treatment to improve mental or physical health.
back_cards.example_en: She’s been going to therapy for anxiety.

back_cards.definition_en: A healing process for emotional issues.
back_cards.example_en: Talking in therapy helped him feel better.

back_cards.definition_en: A medical treatment for recovery.
back_cards.example_en: Physical therapy restored her knee’s strength.

back_cards.definition_en: A method to address specific problems.
back_cards.example_en: The doctor recommended therapy for his injury.

back_cards.definition_en: A supportive process for well-being.
back_cards.example_en: Group therapy offers a sense of community.

back_cards.definition_en: A crime or violation of the law.
back_cards.example_en: Shoplifting is a minor offense in most cases.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of upsetting or insulting someone.
back_cards.example_en: No offense, but your idea needs work.

back_cards.definition_en: The attacking team in sports.
back_cards.example_en: Our team’s offense scored three goals.

back_cards.definition_en: A breach of rules or conduct.
back_cards.example_en: His behavior was an offense to the group.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of offending someone’s feelings.
back_cards.example_en: Her comment caused offense at the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone or something that kills.
back_cards.example_en: The police are searching for the killer.

back_cards.definition_en: Something extremely impressive or effective.
back_cards.example_en: That new app is a killer tool for work.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who commits murder.
back_cards.example_en: The detective tracked down the serial killer.

back_cards.definition_en: Something that causes failure or destruction.
back_cards.example_en: That storm was a killer for the crops.

back_cards.definition_en: A slang term for something awesome.
back_cards.example_en: Her performance was absolutely killer!

back_cards.definition_en: A person’s unique traits or character.
back_cards.example_en: Her bubbly personality lights up the room.

back_cards.definition_en: The qualities that define someone’s behavior.
back_cards.example_en: His personality makes him a great leader.

back_cards.definition_en: A famous or distinctive person.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a TV personality known for her humor.

back_cards.definition_en: The emotional or social characteristics of someone.
back_cards.example_en: Their personalities clashed from the start.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of traits that shape identity.
back_cards.example_en: His kind personality draws people to him.

back_cards.definition_en: The visible features of an area’s terrain.
back_cards.example_en: The mountain landscape was breathtaking.

back_cards.definition_en: A painting or photo of natural scenery.
back_cards.example_en: Her landscape painting won first prize.

back_cards.definition_en: The overall look or layout of something.
back_cards.example_en: The political landscape changed after the election.

back_cards.definition_en: To design or shape outdoor areas.
back_cards.example_en: They hired a team to landscape their yard.

back_cards.definition_en: A broad view or scene of nature.
back_cards.example_en: The desert landscape stretched for miles.

back_cards.definition_en: In a profound or intense way.
back_cards.example_en: She was deeply moved by the speech.

back_cards.definition_en: To a great depth or extent.
back_cards.example_en: He’s deeply involved in the charity project.

back_cards.definition_en: With strong emotion or feeling.
back_cards.example_en: I deeply regret missing your party.

back_cards.definition_en: In a thorough or serious manner.
back_cards.example_en: They discussed the issue deeply for hours.

back_cards.definition_en: Far down or within something.
back_cards.example_en: The roots grow deeply into the soil.

back_cards.definition_en: Fair or sensible; not extreme.
back_cards.example_en: The price seems reasonable for such quality.

back_cards.definition_en: Logical or based on good judgment.
back_cards.example_en: Her argument was reasonable and convincing.

back_cards.definition_en: Moderate or acceptable in degree.
back_cards.example_en: We waited a reasonable time before leaving.

back_cards.definition_en: Capable of rational thought.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a reasonable person who listens well.

back_cards.definition_en: Not excessive or overly demanding.
back_cards.example_en: The boss made a reasonable request for overtime.

back_cards.definition_en: To draw something in by suction.
back_cards.example_en: The vacuum sucks up dirt really well.

back_cards.definition_en: To be very bad or unpleasant.
back_cards.example_en: This movie sucks; let’s watch something else.

back_cards.definition_en: To pull liquid through a straw or mouth.
back_cards.example_en: She sucked the juice through a straw.

back_cards.definition_en: To perform poorly or disappoint.
back_cards.example_en: I sucked at basketball practice today.

back_cards.definition_en: To absorb or take in something.
back_cards.example_en: The sponge sucks up water like crazy.

back_cards.definition_en: The process of changing from one state to another.
back_cards.example_en: The transition to college life was tough.

back_cards.definition_en: A shift or move to something new.
back_cards.example_en: She handled the job transition smoothly.

back_cards.definition_en: A period of change or development.
back_cards.example_en: The company is in a transition phase now.

back_cards.definition_en: To switch or move gradually.
back_cards.example_en: They transitioned to a new software system.

back_cards.definition_en: A change in role or situation.
back_cards.example_en: His transition to manager was challenging.

back_cards.definition_en: To a moderate degree; somewhat.
back_cards.example_en: The test was fairly easy for most students.

back_cards.definition_en: In a just or impartial manner.
back_cards.example_en: The judge treated everyone fairly.

back_cards.definition_en: Reasonably or to a fair extent.
back_cards.example_en: She’s fairly confident about the presentation.

back_cards.definition_en: Quite or to a noticeable degree.
back_cards.example_en: The weather is fairly warm for spring.

back_cards.definition_en: In a fair or honest way.
back_cards.example_en: He played fairly and still won the game.

back_cards.definition_en: A vertical pillar or support in a building.
back_cards.example_en: The porch is held up by stone columns.

back_cards.definition_en: A vertical arrangement of text or numbers.
back_cards.example_en: Check the numbers in the second column.

back_cards.definition_en: A regular article in a publication.
back_cards.example_en: Her column in the magazine is popular.

back_cards.definition_en: A line or formation of people or things.
back_cards.example_en: The soldiers marched in a neat column.

back_cards.definition_en: A structural or decorative upright.
back_cards.example_en: The ancient ruins had tall marble columns.

back_cards.definition_en: To clean something with water or soap.
back_cards.example_en: I need to wash the dishes after dinner.

back_cards.definition_en: To remove dirt or stains.
back_cards.example_en: This soap can wash out tough grease.

back_cards.definition_en: A cleaning process or act.
back_cards.example_en: The car needs a good wash this weekend.

back_cards.definition_en: To flow over or against something.
back_cards.example_en: Waves wash against the shore all day.

back_cards.definition_en: To rinse or clean thoroughly.
back_cards.example_en: She washed her hair with new shampoo.

back_cards.definition_en: A small object used to fasten clothes.
back_cards.example_en: The shirt’s top button is missing.

back_cards.definition_en: A switch or control on a device.
back_cards.example_en: Press the red button to start the machine.

back_cards.definition_en: A badge or small decorative item.
back_cards.example_en: She wore a button with a funny slogan.

back_cards.definition_en: To fasten or close with buttons.
back_cards.example_en: He buttoned his jacket before going out.

back_cards.definition_en: A clickable feature on a screen.
back_cards.example_en: Click the ‘save’ button to store your work.

back_cards.definition_en: A person or group competing against another.
back_cards.example_en: Her opponent in the debate was well-prepared.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who opposes or disagrees.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a strong opponent of the new law.

back_cards.definition_en: A rival in a game or contest.
back_cards.example_en: The boxer faced a tough opponent tonight.

back_cards.definition_en: A challenger in an argument or conflict.
back_cards.example_en: She outsmarted her opponent with facts.

back_cards.definition_en: An adversary in sports or politics.
back_cards.example_en: The team’s opponent scored in the final minute.

back_cards.definition_en: To cause liquid to flow into a container.
back_cards.example_en: She poured coffee into my mug.

back_cards.definition_en: To flow heavily or in large amounts.
back_cards.example_en: Rain poured down all afternoon.

back_cards.definition_en: To serve or dispense a drink.
back_cards.example_en: He poured some wine for the guests.

back_cards.definition_en: To express or release freely.
back_cards.example_en: She poured her heart out to her friend.

back_cards.definition_en: To stream or move continuously.
back_cards.example_en: Crowds poured into the stadium for the game.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who moves to another country to live.
back_cards.example_en: The immigrant started a new life in America.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who settles in a foreign land.
back_cards.example_en: He’s an immigrant from Mexico working here.

back_cards.definition_en: A newcomer to a country seeking opportunity.
back_cards.example_en: The city welcomed immigrants with open arms.

back_cards.definition_en: A person adapting to a new culture.
back_cards.example_en: As an immigrant, she learned English quickly.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who relocates permanently abroad.
back_cards.example_en: The immigrant family opened a local restaurant.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of giving or sharing something out.
back_cards.example_en: The distribution of food was quick and fair.

back_cards.definition_en: The delivery of goods to customers.
back_cards.example_en: Their distribution network covers the whole country.

back_cards.definition_en: The spread or arrangement of something.
back_cards.example_en: The distribution of wealth is uneven here.

back_cards.definition_en: The process of supplying products.
back_cards.example_en: The company handles distribution for small brands.

back_cards.definition_en: A pattern or range of data.
back_cards.example_en: The chart shows the distribution of test scores.

back_cards.definition_en: A sport involving hitting a ball into holes.
back_cards.example_en: We played golf at the country club.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of playing this sport.
back_cards.example_en: He goes golfing every weekend with friends.

back_cards.definition_en: A game using clubs and a small ball.
back_cards.example_en: Golf is harder than it looks on TV.

back_cards.definition_en: A recreational activity on a course.
back_cards.example_en: She took golf lessons to improve her swing.

back_cards.definition_en: A professional or competitive sport.
back_cards.example_en: The golf tournament drew a big crowd.

back_cards.definition_en: Carrying a developing baby in the womb.
back_cards.example_en: She’s pregnant and due in three months.

back_cards.definition_en: Expectant, referring to a woman with child.
back_cards.example_en: The pregnant woman needed a seat on the bus.

back_cards.definition_en: Full of meaning or significance.
back_cards.example_en: Her silence was pregnant with emotion.

back_cards.definition_en: In the state of pregnancy.
back_cards.example_en: She felt great while pregnant with her first child.

back_cards.definition_en: Describing an expectant mother.
back_cards.example_en: The doctor gave advice to the pregnant patient.

back_cards.definition_en: Not able to do something.
back_cards.example_en: I was unable to attend the meeting yesterday.

back_cards.definition_en: Lacking the ability or means.
back_cards.example_en: She’s unable to lift heavy boxes alone.

back_cards.definition_en: Prevented from doing something.
back_cards.example_en: He was unable to call due to no signal.

back_cards.definition_en: Not capable or qualified.
back_cards.example_en: They were unable to solve the puzzle.

back_cards.definition_en: Restricted by circumstances.
back_cards.example_en: We’re unable to travel because of the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: Another option or choice.
back_cards.example_en: We need an alternative plan if this fails.

back_cards.definition_en: A substitute or different approach.
back_cards.example_en: She chose an alternative route to avoid traffic.

back_cards.definition_en: Something different from the usual.
back_cards.example_en: They offer alternative therapies for pain.

back_cards.definition_en: A non-traditional or unconventional option.
back_cards.example_en: Solar power is an alternative to gas.

back_cards.definition_en: A second possibility or method.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s consider an alternative to this design.

back_cards.definition_en: Involving physical force to harm.
back_cards.example_en: The violent storm damaged the house.

back_cards.definition_en: Aggressive or intense in action.
back_cards.example_en: The movie had some violent fight scenes.

back_cards.definition_en: Causing injury or destruction.
back_cards.example_en: Violent protests broke out in the city.

back_cards.definition_en: Marked by extreme force or brutality.
back_cards.example_en: The news reported a violent crime downtown.

back_cards.definition_en: Sudden and severe in nature.
back_cards.example_en: A violent earthquake shook the region.

back_cards.definition_en: A part or share of something.
back_cards.example_en: I ate a small portion of the cake.

back_cards.definition_en: A segment or piece of a whole.
back_cards.example_en: This portion of the road is under repair.

back_cards.definition_en: An amount of food served.
back_cards.example_en: The restaurant serves huge portions.

back_cards.definition_en: A division or allocation.
back_cards.example_en: She donated a portion of her paycheck.

back_cards.definition_en: A section or part of something larger.
back_cards.example_en: A portion of the book was hard to read.

back_cards.definition_en: To gain possession or control of something.
back_cards.example_en: She acquired a rare coin for her collection.

back_cards.definition_en: To learn or develop a skill.
back_cards.example_en: He acquired Spanish during his travels.

back_cards.definition_en: To buy or obtain something.
back_cards.example_en: The company acquired a new office building.

back_cards.definition_en: To take over or receive something.
back_cards.example_en: They acquired new skills at the workshop.

back_cards.definition_en: To come into possession of something.
back_cards.example_en: She acquired a taste for spicy food.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of intentionally ending one’s life.
back_cards.example_en: The community mourned after the tragic suicide.

back_cards.definition_en: A self-destructive action or decision.
back_cards.example_en: Quitting now would be career suicide.

back_cards.definition_en: The deliberate taking of one’s own life.
back_cards.example_en: The hotline offers help for suicide prevention.

back_cards.definition_en: An act of extreme personal distress.
back_cards.example_en: The news reported a rise in suicide rates.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for self-inflicted death.
back_cards.example_en: Counselors discussed ways to prevent suicide.

back_cards.definition_en: To extend or spread out.
back_cards.example_en: The road stretches across the entire valley.

back_cards.definition_en: To pull or lengthen something.
back_cards.example_en: She stretched the rubber band carefully.

back_cards.definition_en: A period or expanse of time or space.
back_cards.example_en: We drove for a long stretch without stopping.

back_cards.definition_en: To exercise by extending muscles.
back_cards.example_en: I stretch every morning to stay flexible.

back_cards.definition_en: To push something to its limits.
back_cards.example_en: The budget was stretched to cover repairs.

back_cards.definition_en: A shortfall or lack of something, especially money.
back_cards.example_en: The company reported a budget deficit this year.

back_cards.definition_en: The amount by which something is too small.
back_cards.example_en: There’s a deficit of 500 votes in the count.

back_cards.definition_en: A financial shortfall in income versus expenses.
back_cards.example_en: The government is addressing the national deficit.

back_cards.definition_en: A lack or shortage of resources.
back_cards.example_en: We have a deficit of staff this week.

back_cards.definition_en: An imbalance or deficiency.
back_cards.example_en: The team faced a deficit in the second half.

back_cards.definition_en: A sign or indication of a disease.
back_cards.example_en: A fever is a common symptom of the flu.

back_cards.definition_en: A clue or evidence of a problem.
back_cards.example_en: Lateness is a symptom of poor time management.

back_cards.definition_en: A physical or mental change indicating illness.
back_cards.example_en: Her symptoms include a cough and fatigue.

back_cards.definition_en: A noticeable effect of an issue.
back_cards.example_en: Stress can cause symptoms like headaches.

back_cards.definition_en: An indicator of an underlying condition.
back_cards.example_en: The doctor asked about all her symptoms.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to the sun or its energy.
back_cards.example_en: Solar panels power their entire house.

back_cards.definition_en: Powered by sunlight.
back_cards.example_en: This solar calculator works in bright light.

back_cards.definition_en: Of or from the sun.
back_cards.example_en: Solar flares can disrupt satellite signals.

back_cards.definition_en: Using the sun’s energy for power.
back_cards.example_en: The farm installed a solar water heater.

back_cards.definition_en: Connected to solar technology or systems.
back_cards.example_en: Solar energy is becoming more affordable.

back_cards.definition_en: A statement expressing dissatisfaction.
back_cards.example_en: She filed a complaint about the service.

back_cards.definition_en: A reason for being unhappy.
back_cards.example_en: His main complaint was the noisy neighbors.

back_cards.definition_en: A formal grievance or objection.
back_cards.example_en: The complaint was sent to the manager.

back_cards.definition_en: A minor health issue or ailment.
back_cards.example_en: He went to the doctor with a stomach complaint.

back_cards.definition_en: An expression of discontent.
back_cards.example_en: Her complaint about the cold was ignored.

back_cards.definition_en: Having the ability to do something.
back_cards.example_en: She’s capable of fixing the car herself.

back_cards.definition_en: Skilled or competent in a task.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a capable leader who inspires trust.

back_cards.definition_en: Able to handle or perform well.
back_cards.example_en: This software is capable of complex calculations.

back_cards.definition_en: Having the potential or capacity.
back_cards.example_en: The team is capable of winning the title.

back_cards.definition_en: Qualified or suitable for a role.
back_cards.example_en: She’s capable of teaching advanced classes.

back_cards.definition_en: To examine something in detail.
back_cards.example_en: We need to analyze the data before deciding.

back_cards.definition_en: To study or break down information.
back_cards.example_en: She analyzed the poem for its themes.

back_cards.definition_en: To investigate or evaluate carefully.
back_cards.example_en: The team will analyze the game footage.

back_cards.definition_en: To assess or interpret evidence.
back_cards.example_en: He analyzed the problem and found a solution.

back_cards.definition_en: To review systematically for understanding.
back_cards.example_en: They’re analyzing the budget for savings.

back_cards.definition_en: Feeling afraid or frightened.
back_cards.example_en: I was scared during the thunderstorm last night.

back_cards.definition_en: Nervous or anxious about something.
back_cards.example_en: She’s scared of speaking in public.

back_cards.definition_en: Experiencing fear or alarm.
back_cards.example_en: The loud noise scared the dog.

back_cards.definition_en: Terrified or startled by something.
back_cards.example_en: He got scared watching that horror movie.

back_cards.definition_en: Feeling uneasy or apprehensive.
back_cards.example_en: I’m scared I won’t finish this on time.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who encourages or helps someone.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a big supporter of local artists.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who backs a cause or team.
back_cards.example_en: The supporters cheered loudly at the game.

back_cards.definition_en: A person providing assistance or resources.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a major supporter of the charity.

back_cards.definition_en: A fan or advocate of a group.
back_cards.example_en: The politician thanked her supporters.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who promotes or defends something.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a supporter of environmental policies.

back_cards.definition_en: To break up or move earth with a tool.
back_cards.example_en: We need to dig a hole for the tree.

back_cards.definition_en: To search or investigate thoroughly.
back_cards.example_en: She dug through the files for evidence.

back_cards.definition_en: To enjoy or appreciate something.
back_cards.example_en: I really dig this new song.

back_cards.definition_en: To excavate or uncover something.
back_cards.example_en: They dug up an old coin in the yard.

back_cards.definition_en: To poke or prod something.
back_cards.example_en: He dug his elbow into my side.

back_cards.definition_en: The number 20.
back_cards.example_en: She bought twenty apples for the party.

back_cards.definition_en: A group or set of 20 items.
back_cards.example_en: There were twenty people at the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to the 1920s decade.
back_cards.example_en: The film is set in the roaring twenties.

back_cards.definition_en: A twenty-dollar bill.
back_cards.example_en: Can you break a twenty for me?

back_cards.definition_en: An age or quantity of 20.
back_cards.example_en: He’s only twenty but already a manager.

back_cards.definition_en: To act as if something is true.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s pretend we’re astronauts on a mission.

back_cards.definition_en: To make believe or imagine.
back_cards.example_en: She pretended to be asleep during class.

back_cards.definition_en: To fake or simulate something.
back_cards.example_en: He pretended to like the gift.

back_cards.definition_en: To play a role or act out.
back_cards.example_en: The kids love pretending to be superheroes.

back_cards.definition_en: To behave falsely for effect.
back_cards.example_en: She pretended she didn’t care, but she did.

back_cards.definition_en: A study of knowledge, reality, and existence.
back_cards.example_en: She’s taking a philosophy class this semester.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of beliefs or principles.
back_cards.example_en: His philosophy is to live and let live.

back_cards.definition_en: The pursuit of wisdom or understanding.
back_cards.example_en: Philosophy helps us question life’s meaning.

back_cards.definition_en: A personal approach or attitude.
back_cards.example_en: Her philosophy on work is quality over speed.

back_cards.definition_en: A system of thought or reasoning.
back_cards.example_en: Stoic philosophy teaches emotional resilience.

back_cards.definition_en: The period of being a child.
back_cards.example_en: Her childhood was full of happy memories.

back_cards.definition_en: The early years of life.
back_cards.example_en: He spent his childhood on a farm.

back_cards.definition_en: A time of innocence or growth.
back_cards.example_en: Childhood is a time for learning and play.

back_cards.definition_en: The state of being a child.
back_cards.example_en: Her childhood ended when she started working.

back_cards.definition_en: Memories or experiences from youth.
back_cards.example_en: His favorite childhood story was about pirates.

back_cards.definition_en: Situated below or at a lower level.
back_cards.example_en: The lower shelves are easier to reach.

back_cards.definition_en: To reduce or decrease something.
back_cards.example_en: They need to lower the price to sell.

back_cards.definition_en: Less in rank, value, or amount.
back_cards.example_en: The lower grades need extra help.

back_cards.definition_en: To bring down or drop something.
back_cards.example_en: She lowered the flag at sunset.

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to a bottom part or area.
back_cards.example_en: The lower part of the wall is painted.

back_cards.definition_en: A large amount of money or assets.
back_cards.example_en: His wealth comes from smart investments.

back_cards.definition_en: Abundance of valuable resources.
back_cards.example_en: The country’s wealth lies in its natural resources.

back_cards.definition_en: Riches or financial prosperity.
back_cards.example_en: She built her wealth through hard work.

back_cards.definition_en: A plentiful supply of something.
back_cards.example_en: The library is a wealth of knowledge.

back_cards.definition_en: Economic or material abundance.
back_cards.example_en: Their wealth allowed for a lavish lifestyle.

back_cards.definition_en: Government aid for those in need.
back_cards.example_en: Welfare helps families afford basic needs.

back_cards.definition_en: The well-being or health of someone.
back_cards.example_en: The school prioritizes student welfare.

back_cards.definition_en: Financial or social support programs.
back_cards.example_en: She applied for welfare after losing her job.

back_cards.definition_en: The state of being healthy or safe.
back_cards.example_en: Animal welfare is her passion.

back_cards.definition_en: Assistance for improving quality of life.
back_cards.example_en: The policy aims to improve public welfare.

back_cards.definition_en: The state of being extremely poor.
back_cards.example_en: Poverty affects many families in the area.

back_cards.definition_en: A lack of money or resources.
back_cards.example_en: He grew up in poverty but succeeded.

back_cards.definition_en: Economic hardship or deprivation.
back_cards.example_en: The charity fights poverty with donations.

back_cards.definition_en: A condition of financial struggle.
back_cards.example_en: Poverty forced her to work two jobs.

back_cards.definition_en: A scarcity of basic needs.
back_cards.example_en: They’re working to reduce global poverty.

back_cards.definition_en: A lawyer who represents the government in court.
back_cards.example_en: The prosecutor presented evidence against the defendant.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who brings criminal charges.
back_cards.example_en: The prosecutor argued for a tough sentence.

back_cards.definition_en: An attorney handling legal accusations.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a skilled prosecutor in high-profile cases.

back_cards.definition_en: A public official in criminal trials.
back_cards.example_en: The prosecutor questioned the witness carefully.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who seeks convictions in court.
back_cards.example_en: The prosecutor worked late on the case.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to the spirit or soul.
back_cards.example_en: She finds peace in spiritual practices.

back_cards.definition_en: Connected to religion or deep beliefs.
back_cards.example_en: The retreat focused on spiritual growth.

back_cards.definition_en: Involving inner peace or meaning.
back_cards.example_en: His spiritual journey led to meditation.

back_cards.definition_en: Beyond the physical or material.
back_cards.example_en: The book explores spiritual themes.

back_cards.definition_en: Pertaining to sacred or divine matters.
back_cards.example_en: Her spiritual beliefs guide her decisions.

back_cards.definition_en: Twice the amount or size.
back_cards.example_en: I’ll take a double espresso, please.

back_cards.definition_en: To multiply something by two.
back_cards.example_en: She doubled the recipe for the party.

back_cards.definition_en: Two of something together.
back_cards.example_en: They booked a double room for the trip.

back_cards.definition_en: To serve two purposes or roles.
back_cards.example_en: He doubles as the coach and referee.

back_cards.definition_en: A pair or duplicate of something.
back_cards.example_en: The stunt double performed the dangerous scene.

back_cards.definition_en: To assess or judge the value of something.
back_cards.example_en: We need to evaluate the project’s success.

back_cards.definition_en: To analyze or review carefully.
back_cards.example_en: She evaluated the data for accuracy.

back_cards.definition_en: To determine the quality or worth.
back_cards.example_en: The teacher evaluated our essays yesterday.

back_cards.definition_en: To appraise or measure performance.
back_cards.example_en: They evaluate employees every six months.

back_cards.definition_en: To consider or examine systematically.
back_cards.example_en: He’s evaluating his options before deciding.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to Israel or its people.
back_cards.example_en: Israeli culture is rich with history.

back_cards.definition_en: A person from Israel.
back_cards.example_en: The Israeli shared stories about Tel Aviv.

back_cards.definition_en: Connected to Israel’s government or policies.
back_cards.example_en: The Israeli embassy hosted a cultural event.

back_cards.definition_en: Describing something from Israel.
back_cards.example_en: Israeli food includes hummus and falafel.

back_cards.definition_en: Of or pertaining to Israel’s society.
back_cards.example_en: Israeli music blends many influences.

back_cards.definition_en: To answer or respond to something.
back_cards.example_en: She replied to my email within minutes.

back_cards.definition_en: A response or answer to a question.
back_cards.example_en: His reply was short but helpful.

back_cards.definition_en: To react or respond in conversation.
back_cards.example_en: He didn’t reply when I asked about his day.

back_cards.definition_en: A written or spoken response.
back_cards.example_en: I’m waiting for her reply to my message.

back_cards.definition_en: To address or acknowledge a statement.
back_cards.example_en: She replied with a smile and a nod.

back_cards.definition_en: A dollar, used informally.
back_cards.example_en: This coffee only costs a couple of bucks.

back_cards.definition_en: A male deer or similar animal.
back_cards.example_en: We saw a buck in the forest today.

back_cards.definition_en: To resist or oppose something.
back_cards.example_en: He bucked the trend and worked alone.

back_cards.definition_en: A sudden jump or movement, like a horse.
back_cards.example_en: The horse bucked when it got scared.

back_cards.definition_en: To pass responsibility to someone else.
back_cards.example_en: She bucked the decision to her boss.

back_cards.definition_en: A sharp tool for cutting.
back_cards.example_en: I need a knife to chop the vegetables.

back_cards.definition_en: A weapon with a blade.
back_cards.example_en: He carried a small knife for safety.

back_cards.definition_en: To cut or stab with a knife.
back_cards.example_en: She knifed through the bread with ease.

back_cards.definition_en: A utensil used for eating or cooking.
back_cards.example_en: The steak knife was very sharp.

back_cards.definition_en: A tool for specific tasks, like carving.
back_cards.example_en: The chef used a knife to carve the meat.

back_cards.definition_en: Circular or shaped like a circle.
back_cards.example_en: The table is round and seats six.

back_cards.definition_en: A series or set of events.
back_cards.example_en: The next round of interviews starts tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: To make something circular or smooth.
back_cards.example_en: She rounded the edges of the wood.

back_cards.definition_en: A single stage in a competition.
back_cards.example_en: He won the first round of the tournament.

back_cards.definition_en: Approximately, as in numbers.
back_cards.example_en: It’s round about 5 miles to the park.

back_cards.definition_en: Short for technology or technical.
back_cards.example_en: The tech industry is growing fast.

back_cards.definition_en: A person skilled in technology.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a tech who fixes our computers.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to technological devices or systems.
back_cards.example_en: This tech gadget is super cool.

back_cards.definition_en: A field involving computers or electronics.
back_cards.example_en: He works in tech support for a startup.

back_cards.definition_en: Modern equipment or innovations.
back_cards.example_en: The new tech makes life so much easier.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who investigates crimes.
back_cards.example_en: The detective solved the robbery case.

back_cards.definition_en: A police officer specializing in investigations.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a detective in the homicide unit.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who searches for clues or evidence.
back_cards.example_en: The detective found fingerprints at the scene.

back_cards.definition_en: A character in mystery stories or shows.
back_cards.example_en: The TV detective always catches the villain.

back_cards.definition_en: A professional who uncovers facts.
back_cards.example_en: The detective interviewed all the witnesses.

back_cards.definition_en: To put things into a bag or container.
back_cards.example_en: I need to pack my suitcase for the trip.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of animals, like wolves.
back_cards.example_en: The wolf pack hunted together at night.

back_cards.definition_en: A bundle or set of items.
back_cards.example_en: She bought a pack of pencils for school.

back_cards.definition_en: To fill or stuff tightly.
back_cards.example_en: They packed the car with camping gear.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of people or things together.
back_cards.example_en: A pack of kids ran through the park.

back_cards.definition_en: A medical or mental health condition.
back_cards.example_en: He was diagnosed with an anxiety disorder.

back_cards.definition_en: A state of confusion or chaos.
back_cards.example_en: The room was in complete disorder after the party.

back_cards.definition_en: A disruption of normal function.
back_cards.example_en: The disorder caused her chronic pain.

back_cards.definition_en: A lack of order or organization.
back_cards.example_en: The files were thrown into disorder.

back_cards.definition_en: A condition affecting behavior or health.
back_cards.example_en: Her sleep disorder keeps her up at night.

back_cards.definition_en: A living being, especially an animal.
back_cards.example_en: The forest is full of strange creatures.

back_cards.definition_en: A person, often with a specific trait.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a sweet creature with a big heart.

back_cards.definition_en: A fictional or mythical being.
back_cards.example_en: The movie featured a scary sea creature.

back_cards.definition_en: Any living thing, human or animal.
back_cards.example_en: Every creature deserves a safe home.

back_cards.definition_en: A being associated with a quality.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a curious creature, always exploring.

back_cards.definition_en: In a careful or attentive way.
back_cards.example_en: She watched the game closely.

back_cards.definition_en: Near or in close proximity.
back_cards.example_en: They live closely together in the village.

back_cards.definition_en: With great attention to detail.
back_cards.example_en: He closely examined the evidence.

back_cards.definition_en: In a tight or intimate manner.
back_cards.example_en: The siblings are very closely bonded.

back_cards.definition_en: Almost or nearly, in comparison.
back_cards.example_en: Her work closely resembles her mentor’s.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to industry or manufacturing.
back_cards.example_en: The city has a large industrial area.

back_cards.definition_en: Designed for heavy-duty or factory use.
back_cards.example_en: This is an industrial strength cleaner.

back_cards.definition_en: Connected to large-scale production.
back_cards.example_en: Industrial machines run the factory.

back_cards.definition_en: Pertaining to industries like mining or steel.
back_cards.example_en: The industrial sector drives the economy.

back_cards.definition_en: Characterized by industry or labor.
back_cards.example_en: The town’s industrial history is fascinating.

back_cards.definition_en: Buildings or places to live.
back_cards.example_en: The city needs more affordable housing.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of providing homes.
back_cards.example_en: Housing the homeless is a priority.

back_cards.definition_en: A structure or shelter for equipment.
back_cards.example_en: The machine’s housing protects its parts.

back_cards.definition_en: Residential buildings or apartments.
back_cards.example_en: New housing developments are popping up.

back_cards.definition_en: The provision of living spaces.
back_cards.example_en: Student housing is near the campus.

back_cards.definition_en: A small piece broken off something.
back_cards.example_en: The cup has a chip on the rim.

back_cards.definition_en: A microchip or electronic circuit.
back_cards.example_en: This chip powers the computer’s processor.

back_cards.definition_en: A thin slice of food, like a potato chip.
back_cards.example_en: I grabbed a bag of chips for the party.

back_cards.definition_en: To cut or break off a small piece.
back_cards.example_en: He chipped the paint off the wall.

back_cards.definition_en: A token or counter used in games.
back_cards.example_en: She bet all her chips in poker.

back_cards.definition_en: Despite the circumstances; anyway.
back_cards.example_en: I’m going hiking regardless of the rain.

back_cards.definition_en: Without concern for something.
back_cards.example_en: She moved forward regardless of the risks.

back_cards.definition_en: In spite of any obstacles.
back_cards.example_en: He succeeded regardless of his challenges.

back_cards.definition_en: No matter what happens.
back_cards.example_en: We’ll finish on time, regardless.

back_cards.definition_en: Ignoring other factors or conditions.
back_cards.example_en: They stayed friends regardless of the fight.

back_cards.definition_en: Many or a large number of something.
back_cards.example_en: She has numerous books on her shelf.

back_cards.definition_en: Consisting of a great amount.
back_cards.example_en: There were numerous complaints about the noise.

back_cards.definition_en: Several or more than a few.
back_cards.example_en: He’s won numerous awards for his work.

back_cards.definition_en: Abundant or plentiful in number.
back_cards.example_en: Numerous birds nested in the trees.

back_cards.definition_en: A considerable quantity.
back_cards.example_en: The store has numerous sales this month.

back_cards.definition_en: To give an order or instruction.
back_cards.example_en: The general commanded the troops to advance.

back_cards.definition_en: An order given with authority.
back_cards.example_en: She followed the coach’s command.

back_cards.definition_en: Control or authority over something.
back_cards.example_en: He has command of the entire fleet.

back_cards.definition_en: To lead or direct with power.
back_cards.example_en: She commands respect in the office.

back_cards.definition_en: A mastery or strong knowledge.
back_cards.example_en: His command of French is impressive.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of firing a gun.
back_cards.example_en: The shooting at the range was loud.

back_cards.definition_en: A violent act involving firearms.
back_cards.example_en: The news reported a shooting downtown.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of filming or photographing.
back_cards.example_en: The movie’s shooting took three months.

back_cards.definition_en: A sports activity involving aiming at targets.
back_cards.example_en: She’s great at shooting in basketball.

back_cards.definition_en: A sudden or rapid action.
back_cards.example_en: Pain was shooting through my leg.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of twelve items.
back_cards.example_en: I bought a dozen eggs at the store.

back_cards.definition_en: A set or collection of twelve.
back_cards.example_en: She owns a dozen pairs of shoes.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to mean many or several.
back_cards.example_en: I’ve told you a dozen times to clean up.

back_cards.definition_en: A standard quantity in retail.
back_cards.example_en: A dozen roses cost twenty dollars.

back_cards.definition_en: A rough estimate of twelve.
back_cards.example_en: There were about a dozen people there.

back_cards.definition_en: A short, sharp sound.
back_cards.example_en: The balloon made a loud pop when it burst.

back_cards.definition_en: To burst or explode suddenly.
back_cards.example_en: The popcorn started to pop in the microwave.

back_cards.definition_en: Soda or a carbonated drink.
back_cards.example_en: Can you grab me a pop from the fridge?

back_cards.definition_en: Popular culture or music.
back_cards.example_en: She loves listening to pop music.

back_cards.definition_en: To appear or happen quickly.
back_cards.example_en: He popped up at the party unexpectedly.

back_cards.definition_en: A single thickness of material.
back_cards.example_en: Add a layer of frosting to the cake.

back_cards.definition_en: One level or part of something.
back_cards.example_en: The painting has layers of vibrant colors.

back_cards.definition_en: To arrange or stack in layers.
back_cards.example_en: She layered her clothes for warmth.

back_cards.definition_en: A coating or covering of something.
back_cards.example_en: A layer of dust covered the old book.

back_cards.definition_en: A level of complexity or depth.
back_cards.example_en: The story has multiple layers of meaning.

back_cards.definition_en: A food made from flour and water.
back_cards.example_en: I baked fresh bread for dinner.

back_cards.definition_en: Slang for money or income.
back_cards.example_en: He’s out earning bread for his family.

back_cards.definition_en: A staple food in many cultures.
back_cards.example_en: She served warm bread with butter.

back_cards.definition_en: A loaf or slice of baked dough.
back_cards.example_en: This bread is crusty and delicious.

back_cards.definition_en: A basic necessity or sustenance.
back_cards.example_en: Bread and water kept them going.

back_cards.definition_en: Something that doesn’t follow a rule.
back_cards.example_en: She’s the exception to the strict policy.

back_cards.definition_en: An exclusion or special case.
back_cards.example_en: Everyone left early, with one exception.

back_cards.definition_en: A deviation from the norm.
back_cards.example_en: This warm winter is an exception.

back_cards.definition_en: Something or someone outstanding.
back_cards.example_en: His talent is an exception in the team.

back_cards.definition_en: A situation that differs from others.
back_cards.example_en: Late arrivals are an exception here.

back_cards.definition_en: A strong feeling of enthusiasm or love.
back_cards.example_en: Her passion for music inspires everyone.

back_cards.definition_en: Intense emotion or desire.
back_cards.example_en: He spoke with passion about his dreams.

back_cards.definition_en: A deep interest or devotion.
back_cards.example_en: Cooking is her greatest passion.

back_cards.definition_en: Strong romantic or emotional attraction.
back_cards.example_en: Their passion for each other was obvious.

back_cards.definition_en: An activity pursued with great energy.
back_cards.example_en: His passion for hiking takes him everywhere.

back_cards.definition_en: A major road for vehicles.
back_cards.example_en: The highway was packed during rush hour.

back_cards.definition_en: A main route for travel.
back_cards.example_en: We took the highway to the city.

back_cards.definition_en: A large road connecting places.
back_cards.example_en: The new highway cuts travel time.

back_cards.definition_en: A public road for fast travel.
back_cards.example_en: Trucks filled the highway all night.

back_cards.definition_en: A key transportation route.
back_cards.example_en: The highway runs through the mountains.

back_cards.definition_en: Not mixed with anything else.
back_cards.example_en: This is pure honey from the farm.

back_cards.definition_en: Clean or free from impurities.
back_cards.example_en: The water here is pure and safe.

back_cards.definition_en: Complete or absolute.
back_cards.example_en: It was a moment of pure joy.

back_cards.definition_en: Innocent or morally good.
back_cards.example_en: Her intentions were pure and kind.

back_cards.definition_en: Unadulterated or genuine.
back_cards.example_en: The fabric is made of pure cotton.

back_cards.definition_en: A leader of a military unit.
back_cards.example_en: The commander led the troops into battle.

back_cards.definition_en: A person in charge or authority.
back_cards.example_en: She’s the commander of the rescue team.

back_cards.definition_en: A high-ranking officer in the armed forces.
back_cards.example_en: The commander gave a strategic order.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who directs or controls.
back_cards.example_en: He’s the commander of the space mission.

back_cards.definition_en: A leader with decision-making power.
back_cards.example_en: The commander made a tough call.

back_cards.definition_en: Very severe or intense.
back_cards.example_en: The extreme heat made hiking difficult.

back_cards.definition_en: The furthest or highest degree.
back_cards.example_en: She lives in extreme poverty.

back_cards.definition_en: Unusual or far from normal.
back_cards.example_en: His extreme views sparked debate.

back_cards.definition_en: Radical or excessive in nature.
back_cards.example_en: Extreme sports like skydiving excite her.

back_cards.definition_en: At the outermost limit.
back_cards.example_en: The storm hit the extreme north of the state.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of publishing something.
back_cards.example_en: The book’s publication is next month.

back_cards.definition_en: A printed work like a book or magazine.
back_cards.example_en: This publication covers local news.

back_cards.definition_en: The release of information to the public.
back_cards.example_en: The report’s publication caused a stir.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of published writing.
back_cards.example_en: Her article appeared in a major publication.

back_cards.definition_en: The process of making something public.
back_cards.example_en: The publication of the study was delayed.

back_cards.definition_en: A bad habit or immoral behavior.
back_cards.example_en: Smoking is his only vice.

back_cards.definition_en: A deputy or second-in-command.
back_cards.example_en: The vice president chaired the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: A fault or weakness in character.
back_cards.example_en: Greed is a common human vice.

back_cards.definition_en: Criminal or immoral activity.
back_cards.example_en: The police cracked down on vice in the city.

back_cards.definition_en: A substitute or assistant leader.
back_cards.example_en: She’s the vice captain of the team.

back_cards.definition_en: A man or boy, used informally.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a nice fellow who helps everyone.

back_cards.definition_en: A peer or colleague.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a fellow teacher at my school.

back_cards.definition_en: A member of a group or society.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a fellow of the science academy.

back_cards.definition_en: A friendly term for a person.
back_cards.example_en: That fellow over there is my neighbor.

back_cards.definition_en: A companion or associate.
back_cards.example_en: My fellow hikers shared their snacks.
